decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 2267-PL-L&B Rev A (Location and Block Plan); 2267-Site Plan (Existing Site Plan); 2267-PD-001 (Existing Ground Floor Plan); 2267-PD-002 (Existing First Floor Plan); 2267-PD-003 (Existing Loft Floor Plan); 2267-PD-004 (Existing Roof Plan); 2267-PD-005 (Existing Elevations); 2267-Site Plan Rev A (Proposed Site Plan); 2267-PD-101 Rev A (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); 2267-PD-102 Rev A (Proposed First Floor Plan); 2267-PD-103 Rev A (Proposed Second Floor Plan); 2267-PD-104 Rev B (Proposed Roof Plan); 2267-PL-105 Rev B (Proposed Elevations); 2267-PL-106 Rev A (Proposed Streetscene).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Details of the materials and finishes (including fenestration) to be used for all external surfaces of the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the super structure is commenced. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18) and the NPPF (2021).

| Details of hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatments for the buildings and boundary walls shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the super structure works. The approved details shall be laid out and planted prior to the occupation of the development. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained permanently.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3, D4, G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 9: Trees and Development Guidelines.

| Prior to the installation and/or construction of the bin storage facilities, shown on the approved plans listed in Condition 2, details of the siting, height, elevations and external finishes of the structures shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing.

Reason: To ensure that the structures harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18) and the NPPF (2021).

| No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until cycle parking facilities for two (2) bicycles have been provided within the curtilage of the application site. Such facilities shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate bicycle storage provision and in the interests of reducing congestion to the local transport network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1(i) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).

| The rooflights of the hereby approved development shall not protrude more than 0.15 metres beyond the plane of the slope of the roof when measured from the perpendicular with the external surface of the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure the development harmonises with the surroundings, in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).
| No part of the flat roof of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| The proposed upper floor side elevational windows of the hereby approved development shall at no time be openable or glazed, otherwise than in obscured glass, below a minimum height of 1.7 metres (5'7") above the relevant floor level.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting that Order) no external alterations or extensions shall be carried out to the building(s) hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting that Order) no building, enclosure or swimming pool falling within Part 1, Class E, shall be erected on any part of the land, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB). The sound insulation of the building envelope shall achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Section 6 of Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building).  The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).
| During the implementation of the development hereby approved, control measures shall ensure that the following standards and requirements are implemented and adhered to:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing DM DPD (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan 2021, the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise density.
subdivision_of_building: The proposal does not affect the existing building
description: Construction of a two-storey, detached dwellinghouse with associated amenity space, cycle storage, bin storage and parking space
